thread.title: Toasting Britain's best winter ales
thread.title_full: Toasting Britain's best winter ales | Anglia - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Toasting Britain's best winter ales
text:
Click below to watch a video report on the judging at the Winter Beer festival by ITV News Anglia's Malcolm Robertson
Play video For the first time in its 20-year history, the National Winter Ales Festival has come to the Anglia region.
The historic St Andrews and Blackfriars Halls in Norwich are hosting the event.
Before opening to the public on Wednesday 22 February, judging is taking place to establish the overall British champion.
It's a tough job but someone has to do it: judging Britain's best winter ales. Credit: ITV News Anglia The Milton Brewery from Waterbeach in Cambridgeshire is among those shortlisted.
Richard Naisby's hoping his 7.5% Imperial Russian stout called Marcus Aurelius will prove a hit with judges.
The other regional breweries shortlisted are Adnams from Southwold, Green Jack from Lowestoft and the Cambridge Brew House.
The Milton Brewery from Waterbeach in Cambridgeshire is among those shortlisted. Credit: ITV News Anglia "We like to think of it as the brewer's Olympics
"We have won the regional round of East Anglia, and now we're up for the national award.
"It's nice to win, but not the end of the world if we don't. It's just good to to be recognised by national drinkers."
â€“ Richard Naisby, Milton Brewery Judging underway at the National Winter Ales Festival in Norwich. Credit: ITV News Anglia Norwich will be the festival venue for the next three years.
The event runs until Saturday.
Last updated Tue 21 Feb 2017 Consumer Beer Norfolk
